snippet: The 11th commandment at the heart of the BBC scandal: you’re not doing anything wrong if the only people who know are you, the person you’re doing it to and the people you’re doing it with.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author James Meek contends that at heart of BBC scandal involving former TV personality Jimmy Savile, is idea that one is not doing anything wrong as long as no one finds out; contends this idea seems to be recurring with dismal frequency in British public life.
lead_paragraph: The 11th commandment at the heart of the BBC scandal: you’re not doing anything wrong if the only people who know are you, the person you’re doing it to and the people you’re doing it with.
